Name: rare earth oxides production, from rare earth carbonate concentrate | samarium oxide | EN15804GD, U
Category: B:Mining and quarrying/07:Mining of metal ores/072:Mining of non-ferrous metal ores/0729:Mining of other non-ferrous metal ores
Description: This dataset refers to the extraction (calcination) and refining (solvent extraction) of individual rare earth oxides, obtained from mined rare earth carbonates. ""After drying and calcination, 90−92% mixed REOs are produced. The REO mixture from the leaching process undergoes a combined solvent extraction process at a facility in Southern China. The process inventory includes conversion to RE chlorides, repeated SX using organic solvents such as P204 and P507 and precipitation using oxalic acid. The high purity individual RE precipitate is further roasted to obtain separated pure oxides."" Source: Arshi, P. S., Vahidi, E., & Zhao, F. (2018). Behind the Scenes of Clean Energy: The Environmental Footprint of Rare Earth Products. ACS Sustainable Chemistry & Engineering, 6(3), 3311-3320. doi:10.1021/acssuschemeng.7b03484
